'''Chase the Skies''' is a [[game drop]] that released on June 17, 2025, as [[Java Edition 1.21.6]] and [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.90]]. It focuses on the [[happy ghast]]s and [[harness]]es, improved mechanics for [[lead]]s, craftable [[saddle]]s, new background [[music]], the "[[Tears]]" and "[[Music Disc Lava Chicken|Lava Chicken]]" music discs, the [[Locator Bar|player locator bar]], as well as [[Vibrant Visuals]] {{in|bedrock}}. The first features of this game drop was revealed on [[Minecraft LIVE – March 2025]].

During development, the update was referred to as '''Summer Drop 2025''' and '''Drop 2 2025''' as the name of the {{edition|be}} [[experiment]]. The final name of the update was revealed in a [[minecraft.net]] article on June 1, 2025.<ref>{{mcnet|chase-the-skies-coming|Our next game drop has a name|June 1, 2025|Sophie Austin}}</ref>

== Additions ==

=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Dried Ghast JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Dried ghast]]'''
* Naturally generates next to [[Nether fossil]]s in [[Soul Sand Valley|soul sand valleys]].
* Can be obtained through [[bartering]] with piglins.
* Crafted with [[soul sand]] and 8 [[ghast tear]]s.
* When put in [[water]], the block's appearance changes 3 times depending on the time spent hydrated, changing its facial expression. After this, it becomes a [[ghastling]].

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Happy Ghast Spawn Egg}} [[Happy ghast spawn egg]]'''
*Used to spawn a [[happy ghast]].

'''{{InvSprite|White Harness}} {{InvSprite|Light Gray Harness}} {{InvSprite|Gray Harness}} {{InvSprite|Black Harness}} {{InvSprite|Brown Harness}} {{InvSprite|Red Harness}} {{InvSprite|Orange Harness}} {{InvSprite|Yellow Harness}} {{InvSprite|Lime Harness}} {{InvSprite|Green Harness}} {{InvSprite|Cyan Harness}} {{InvSprite|Light Blue Harness}} {{InvSprite|Blue Harness}} {{InvSprite|Purple Harness}} {{InvSprite|Magenta Harness}} {{InvSprite|Pink Harness}} [[Harness]]'''
*Used to pilot a happy ghast.
*Crafted with [[leather]], [[glass]], and [[wool]].
*Comes in 16 colors based on the color of the wool.

'''{{InvSprite|Music Disc Lava Chicken}} [[Music Disc Lava Chicken|"Lava Chicken" music disc]]'''<ref group="note" name="hotfixwarning">This was added in the [[1.21.7]]/[[Bedrock Edition 1.21.93|1.21.93]] hotfixes and not in the first release, although they're still considered part of the drop.</ref>

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Happy Ghast BE1.gif|32px]] [[Happy ghast]]'''
* A passive version of the [[ghast]], which can be equipped with a [[harness]] and ridden by up to four players.
* Can be stood on, similar to a [[shulker]].
* When not being ridden, will approach players holding [[snowball]]s.
* [[File:Ghastling BE1.gif|32px]] Baby version is called a ghastling.
** Have a unique texture and sounds.
** Spawned after a [[dried ghast]] gets hydrated in [[water]].
** Follows any passive or nutral [[animal]].
** Can be fed [[snowball]]s to speed up their growth.

=== GUI ===
'''[[Locator bar]]'''
*The locator bar is a new UI element on the player HUD that displays the direction of other players in the world.
*When the <code>{{va|locatorBar}}</code> [[game rule]] is enabled and there are multiple players in a world, the locator bar will appear on-screen for each player, replacing the experience bar. The player's [[experience]] level will still be visible as before above the locator bar.
*The locator bar will display colored indicators when the camera is facing within 120 degrees towards another player. If another player is 30 degrees above or below the camera's viewport (the screen), an up or down arrow will be displayed.
*Players in [[Spectator]] mode are not visible on the locator bar.
*A player can hide and prevent their indicator from appearing on the locator bar via the following means:
**[[Sneaking]].
**Wearing a [[head]] or a [[carved pumpkin]].
**Being under the [[Invisibility]] effect.
*Can be disabled by map creator or server operator.
*The locator bar can be used to locate entities other than the player, controlled by {{attr|waypoint_transmit_range}} and {{attr|waypoint_receive_range}} attributes.
*The locator bar [[waypoint style]]s can be changed by {{cmd|waypoint}} command.{{Only|je|short=1}}
*The locator bar is in place of the EXP bar, but the EXP bar will show for a short time after collecting EXP.

=== Graphics ===
'''[[Vibrant Visuals]]'''{{Only|be|short=1}}
* The new default graphics setting on supported devices, placed above the Simple and Fancy settings.
* Adds pixel-perfect shadows, directional lighting, water caustics, and many more graphical features.
* Planned for release on {{JE}} at a later date.

'''[[O's Piano]]'''

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''{{Animate|Terracotta JE2 BE2.png;White Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Light Gray Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Gray Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Black Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Brown Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Red Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Orange Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Yellow Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Lime Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Green Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Cyan Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Light Blue Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Blue Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Purple Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Magenta Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Pink Terracotta JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Terracotta]] and [[stained terracotta]]'''
* No longer emit ambient sounds.

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Lead}} [[Lead]]'''
* Is now crafted with 5 [[string]], with the former [[slimeball]] in its recipe replaced by an additional piece of string.
{{Crafting
|A1 = String
|A2 = String
|A3 = 
|B1 = String
|B2 = String
|B3 = 
|C1 = 
|C2 = 
|C3 = String
|Output = Lead,2
|ignoreusage = 1
}}
* Entities can now be attached to other entities with leads.
* Can now be removed from entities using [[shears]], including [[dispenser]]s containing shears.
* Snapping distance has been increased to 12 blocks.

'''{{InvSprite|Leather}} [[Leather]]'''
* Can now be found in [[monster room]], [[ancient city]], [[desert pyramid]], [[jungle pyramid]] and [[stronghold]] altar chests in quantities 1-5, replacing [[saddle]]s.

'''{{InvSprite|Saddle}} [[Saddle]]'''
* Can now be crafted with 3 [[leather]] and 1 [[iron ingot]].
{{Crafting
|A1 = 
|A2 = Leather
|A3 = 
|B1 = Leather
|B2 = Iron Ingot
|B3 = 
|C1 = 
|C2 = Leather
|C3 = 
|Output = Saddle
|ignoreusage = 1
}}
* Can now be removed from mobs wearing them by using shears on the mob.
** Cannot be removed this way from [[ravager]]s or mobs with riders.
** Can no longer be equipped using dispensers.
* No longer found in chests in [[monster room]]s, [[ancient cities]], [[desert pyramid]]s, [[jungle pyramid]]s and in [[stronghold]] altar chests.

'''{{InvSprite|Shears}} [[Shears]]'''
* Can now remove [[saddle]]s, [[horse armor]], [[harness]]es and [[carpet]]s from mobs.
*Can now cut [[lead]]s.
** They cannot be removed if the mob has a rider.
** They cannot be removed if the player is crouching.
* Saddles cannot be removed from [[ravager]]s.
* Dispensers with shears cannot remove saddles, horse armor, harnesses and carpets equipped on mobs.
'''{{InvSprite|Carrot}} [[Carrot]]'''
* Can now be used to [[tame]], heal, and grow [[horse]]s, [[donkey]]s, and [[mule]]s.

'''{{InvSprite|Breeze Spawn Egg}} {{InvSprite|Blaze Spawn Egg}} [[Spawn Egg]]s'''
* Change [[blaze]] and [[breeze]] spawn egg sizes to more accurately represent the mobs.

'''{{InvSprite|Splash Water Bottle}} [[Splash potion]]'''
* Splash potions now have a duration that varies based on distance from the impact point. If a splash potion directly hits an entity, the entity receives the full duration and potency of the effect. However, if the entity is further away from the impact, the effect's duration and potency decrease linearly.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Ghast JE3 BE3.gif|32px]] [[Ghast]]'''
* The resolution of the ghast texture has been doubled to match the new happy ghasts.
* Now drops a [[Music Disc Tears|”Tears” music disc]] when player kills it using a deflected [[fireball]].

=== Graphics ===
'''[[Clouds]]'''
* The texture for cloud distribution has been changed.
** Now has more, smaller gaps between the clouds.
** Clouds are of a more consistent, oval shape than before.
** Now has a creeper face made up of clouds in a certain section of the texture.
* Cloud render distance has been increased.

== Further revisions ==
=== ''Java Edition'' ===
* [[Java Edition 1.21.7|1.21.7]] added the "Dennis" [[painting]] variant and the [[Music Disc Lava Chicken|"Lava Chicken" music disc]].
* [[Java Edition 1.21.8|1.21.8]] was a minor hotfix update.

=== ''Bedrock Edition'' ===
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.91|1.21.91]] was released to fix bugs related to 1.21.90.
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.92|1.21.92]] was released to fix bugs related to 1.21.91.
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.93|1.21.93]] added the [[Music Disc Lava Chicken|"Lava Chicken" music disc]].
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.94|1.21.94]] was released to fix bugs related to 1.21.92 and 1.21.93.
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.100|1.21.100]] was a minor update which adds "The Void" flat world preset and experimental features for [[The Copper Age]].
* [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.101|1.21.101]] was released to fix bugs related to 1.21.100.

=== Vibrant Memories ===
{{Main|Vibrant Memories Add-On}}
[[File:Minecraft Vibrant Memories.jpeg|thumb|Key art for the add-on.]]
The day following the drop's release, an [[add-on]] was published to promote the introduction of Vibrant Visuals. Developed by [[Oreville Studios]], the add-on allows players to immortalize specific locations and memories in their worlds.
{{-}}

=== Take on Ghastastic Challenges ===
{{See also|Chase the Skies (skin pack)}} 
[[File:Take on Ghastastic Challenges.jpeg|thumb|Key art for the event.]]
To promote the release of the drop, an advertising campaign began on June 20, 2025, featuring two community challenges. For Bedrock players, they earned the two items. For Java players, a [[Chase the Skies (skin pack)|skin pack]] was also released to reward progress.
